entry.title: Who will win Muslims vote in UP?

link.title: Who will win Muslims vote in UP?

entry.content:
• Emotion Analysis of a Political Survey: Uttar Pradesh( India)
  • Total number of face detected in Video: 95
  • Emotions detected in the Video
  • Final Verdict

Emotion Analysis of a Political Survey: Uttar Pradesh( India)

In the current rage of political festival, Uttar Pradesh election in India holds a really important role. Every party involved, are fighting with their maximum capacity to capture this largest and most diverse demographic state. Here, I have used a small survey by reporters from National Dastak doing survey at the ground level, joined some samples from videos and did emotion analytics using Microsoft API to get a snapshot of Muslims support in some of the important political districts.

Important places that came up in the survey of Eastern UP:

Maharajganj, Kushinagar, gorakhpur, Azamgarh, Mau, Baliya

First, step is to take covert the video to the required quantitative information that involves frame by frame emotion detection with relative degree of probability. I have used Microsoft Emotions API to get the required analyzed data.

Getting the feel of the data.

The data is really chaotic as far as face detection is concerned as the survey was done live and raw. Just to give the glimpse of how face were detected, I have included “face positions plot”.

Total number of face detected in Video: 95

It is clear from the plot that face positions are very chaotic and noisy. So, here I have tried to capture the bigger picture, that is what is the combined sentiment of the crowd of the sampled video.

Emotions detected in the Video

To get a better relative sense, frame by frame:

Removing neutral emotion and gathering frame by frame.

Now, to sum it up let’s have a look at bar plot which brings the clarity about which emotion dominated throughout the survey.

Although, it is difficult to give the final verdict based on limited and raw survey where the video is being captured in an unplanned setting, however it might come to our help that using analytics we can locate the “time stamp”” of interesting show of emotions and with additional minimal manual touch, it gives a good picture of the target audience about the given topic.

In this case, I checked all the interesting show of emotions, like
1. people were generally taking the interview lightly and hence the higher values of “happiness”.
2. BSP( regional UP party) was mostly mentioned in the happy time slot.
3. There were visible show of “anger” and “disgust” against the SP( samajwadi party).
4. No mention of BJP (Bhartiya Janta Party), by the people.

Final Verdict

Based on the help provided by the “Emotion analytics” and some manual labor, Muslims are mostly inclined towards BSP in Maharajganj, Kushinagar, gorakhpur, Azamgarh, Mau, Baliya political constituency.
entry.summary:
Emotion Analysis of a Political Survey: Uttar Pradesh( India)
Emotion Analysis of a Political Survey: Uttar Pradesh( India)
In the current rage of political festival, Uttar Pradesh election in India holds a really important role. Every party involved, are fighting with their maximum capacity to capture this largest and most diverse demographic state. Here, I have used a small survey by reporters from National Dastak doing survey at the ground level, joined some samples from videos and did emotion analytics using Microsoft API to get a snapshot of Muslims support in some of the important political districts.
Important places that came up in the survey of Eastern UP:
Maharajganj, Kushinagar, gorakhpur, Azamgarh, Mau, Baliya
First, step is to take covert the video to the required quantitative information that involves frame by frame emotion detection with relative degree of probability. I have used Microsoft Emotions API to get the required analyzed data.
Getting the feel of the data.
## converting long format f_long <- f %>% gather(emotion, value, neutral:contempt) glimpse(f_long)

entry.title: Bollywood Fight: Kaabil vs Raees
entry.content:
• R Markdown
  • 1) Comparison of total earnings:
  • 2) Comparison of total net profit:
  • 3) Number of Screes worldwide
    • 4) Final Verdict
  • Kaabil did beat Raees

R Markdown

I am not a big fan of usual bollywood movies, but in a country that is obssesed with bollywood and bollywood stars, it’s really hard for anyone to be separate from this industries activities.

Recently, Sharukh’s and Hritik’s ( bollywood superstars) fans were fighing all over the social media about who earned more money, apparently that’s the paramenter of success in India big screens. Various sources of Media reported different facts and figures to declare a winner.

However, I was really pissed at the parameter of comparison without the regard for all the facts and its relative cause on the outcome. So, I scrapped the data from a famous media source (India Today) and tried to find the real winner.

Getting the data:

Plotting the final data frame:

1) Comparison of total earnings:

But, is it right to declare the winner wrt to earnings? What about budget? Number of screen’s the movies were released? Let’s look further and decide for ourselves:

2) Comparison of total net profit:

3) Number of Screes worldwide

It is again an important factor to consider as more screens means more business. There are lot of figures available from different sources, so it’s hard to get the exact data. However rougly speaking, Raees was released in lot more screeens.

Number of Screens( Kaabil): 2800+ worldwide

### Number of Screens(Raees) : 3000 Screens + worldwide

4) Final Verdict

Clearly, when it came to better returns on investment :

Kaabil did beat Raees

##I mean,that’s what the data speaks!!

What do you think?

entry.title: India 2016, Statewise Cyber Crimes based on Motives

link.title: India 2016, Statewise Cyber Crimes based on Motives

entry.content: Although, data availability in India regarding the Cyber Crimes and activities is really poor, here's an attempt to show the crimes committed in the Cyber space with the motives which is available to the Government of India, with Maharashtra topping the list and top motives being eve teasing or harassment, fraud or illegal activity and prank satisfaction of gaining control. # Maharashra tops the list
entry.summary: Although, data availability in India regarding the Cyber Crimes and activities is really poor, here's an attempt to show the crimes committed in the Cyber space with the motives which is available to the Government of India, with Maharashtra topping the list and top motives being eve teasing or harassment, fraud or illegal activity and prank satisfaction of gaining control.

entry.title: Terror related deaths in Kashmir since 1988

link.title: Terror related deaths in Kashmir since 1988

entry.content:
This interactive piece of information gives a glimpse of the Kashmir Situation in India. It is a disputed territory since 1947, and already three war have been fought over this piece of land !!!
The root of conflict between the Kashmiri insurgents and the Indian Government is tied to a dispute over local autonomy. Although the situation has been violent since the division of India,In 1987, a disputed state election created a catalyst for the insurgency when it resulted in some of the state's legislative assembly members forming armed insurgent groups. In July 1988 a series of demonstrations, strikes and attacks on the Indian Government began the Kashmir Insurgency.

By looking at the graphic, it is evident that situation is relatively peaceful past 10 years as compared to the 90s. There has been drastic decrease in the terror related incidents which makes one hopeful of the future however recent unrest in the valley is the red alert to the security agencies and questions the local leaders involvement in the process.
entry.summary: This interactive piece of information gives a glimpse of the Kashmir Situation in India. It is a disputed territory since 1947, and already three war have been fought over this piece of land !!!The root of conflict between the Kashmiri insurgents and the Indian Government is tied to a dispute over local autonomy. In July 1988 a series of demonstrations, strikes and attacks on the Indian Government began the Kashmir Insurgency.By looking at the graphic, it is evident that situation is relatively peaceful past 10 years as compared to the 90s. There has been drastic decrease in the terror related incidents which makes one hopeful of the future however recent unrest in the valley is the red alert to the security agencies and questions the local leaders involvement in the process.

entry.title: Sentiment Analysis of PM Modi’s Speech at US Congress Joint Session

link.title: Sentiment Analysis of PM Modi's Speech at US Congress Joint Session

entry.content:
To start this "Speech Analysis". Firslty, wordcloud has been included. Well, what is word cloud? "It is simply the display of words used in the given text based on their frequency."!!

Looking at the wordcloud, we can automatically have a glimpse of the larger overview of the speech. US- India partnership in the present context is visible here.

    WordCloud
 


Next step of the analysis: "Sentiment Analysis of the Speech".


Beautification of the chart has been done in R and Plotly ( What is Plotly ?)

After observing the "LOESS Smoothing" of the data, we can observe that the speech is showing the inclination towards the positive side of the sentiment in most of the part. The visible trough  in the second quarter is due to the terror attack reference happened in India.

It was indeed a well thought out aggregation of words that will have a far reaching consequences on the relationships of the worlds largest democracies!!
entry.summary: To start this "Speech Analysis". Firslty, wordcloud has been included. Well, what is word cloud? "It is simply the display of words used in the given text based on their frequency."!!Looking at the wordcloud, we can automatically have a glimpse of the larger overview of the speech. US- India partnership in the present context is visible here.    WordCloud Next step of the analysis: "Sentiment Analysis of the Speech". Beautification of the chart has been done in R and Plotly ( What is Plotly ?)After observing the "LOESS Smoothing" of the data, we can observe that the speech is showing the inclination towards the positive side of the sentiment in most of the part. The visible trough  in the second quarter is due to the terror attack reference happened in India.It was indeed a well thought out aggregation of words that will have a far reaching consequences on the relationships of the worlds largest democracies!!

entry.title: Serial Killers around the world
entry.content:
Time and again our society has been terrorized by the much dreaded serial killers. It has always been the fascination of major crime novels, sitcoms and movies. FBI defines serial killing as "a series of two or more murders, committed as separate events, usually, but not always, by one offender acting alone". Although psychological gratification is the usual motive for serial killing, and most serial killings involve sexual contact with the victim,the FBI states that the motives of serial killers can include anger, thrill seeking, financial gain, and attention seeking.


Have a look at the interactive piece that lets you know about the serial killers around the world. The data has been scraped from the Wikipedia.
entry.summary: Time and again our society has been terrorized by the much dreaded serial killers. It has always been the fascination of major crime novels, sitcoms and movies. FBI defines serial killing as "a series of two or more murders, committed as separate events, usually, but not always, by one offender acting alone". Although psychological gratification is the usual motive for serial killing, and most serial killings involve sexual contact with the victim,the FBI states that the motives of serial killers can include anger, thrill seeking, financial gain, and attention seeking.Have a look at the interactive piece that lets you know about the serial killers around the world. The data has been scraped from the Wikipedia.

entry.title: Comparative Viz of top Countries/Organizations with maximum number of Satellites

link.title: Comparative Viz of top Countries/Organizations with maximum number of Satellites

entry.content:
India’s own navigational system, the set-up for which was completed on recently  with the launch of the seventh and final satellite, and was called NAVIC (Navigation with Indian Constellation), Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced after the launch. A remarkable feat achieved by ISRO, a hugely successful space agency of a developing country, India.

To put it in perspective, here is the chart that helps in comparing the number of satellites by the Space Agencies around the world, only top 20 has been included.
